Name: Extending the biotechnology credit against the unincorporated business tax and the general corporation tax.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the biotechnology credit against the unincorporated business tax and the general corporation tax

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

Summary: This bill would extend the biotechnology tax credit against the unincorporated business tax and the general corporation tax through December 31, 2018.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Subparagraph 8 of paragraph (a) of subdivision (o) of section 11-503 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 61 for the year 2012, is amended to read as follows:
      (8) The credit allowed under this subdivision shall only be allowed for taxable years beginning on or after January first, two thousand ten and before January first, two thousand [sixteen]nineteen.
      �2. Subparagraph 8 of paragraph (a) of subdivision 21 of section 11-604 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 61 for the year 2012, is amended to read as follows:
      (8) The credit allowed under this subdivision shall only be allowed for taxable years beginning on or after January first, two thousand ten and before January first, two thousand [sixteen]nineteen.
      � 3. Section 5 of local law number 67 for the year 2009, as amended by local law number 61 for the year 2012, is amended to read as follows:
      � 5. This local law shall take effect immediately; provided, however, that this local law shall apply to taxable years beginning on or after January 1, 2010 and before January 1, [2016]2019.
      � 4. This local law shall take effect immediately and, if it shall have become a law after December 31, 2015, shall be retroactive to and deemed to have been in full force and effect as of December 31, 2015.


RC 10-2-15, amended 10-20-15
LS #3669
      1
      
      
      2

\fs24 (8) The credit allowed under this subdivision shall only be allowed for taxable years beginning on or after January first, two thousand ten and before January first, two thousand [sixteen]\ul nineteen\ulnone .\fs27\par
\fs24\'a72. Subparagraph 8 of paragraph (a) of subdivision 21 of section 11-604 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 61 for the year 2012, is amended to read as follows:\fs27\par
\fs24 (8) The credit allowed under this subdivision shall only be allowed for taxable years beginning on or after January first, two thousand ten and before January first, two thousand [sixteen]\ul nineteen\ulnone .\fs27\par
\fs24\'a7 3. Section 5 of local law number 67 for the year 2009, as amended by local law number 61 for the year 2012, is amended to read as follows:\fs27\par

\fs24\'a7 4. This local law shall take effect immediately and, if it shall have become a law after December 31, 2015, shall be retroactive to and deemed to have been in full force and effect as of December 31, 2015.\cf0\ul\par
